nl.naturalis.oaipmh.geneious

Class ListRecordsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.oaipmh.geneious.ListRecordsHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DnaExtractListRecordsHandler

    public abstract class ListRecordsHandler
extends Object

    Abstract base class for handlers for the ListRecords protocol request.

    Filtering and sorting

    This describes how database records are filtered and sorted as part of the OAI-PMH generation process:

    1. First, a SQL query is issued that only selects records from the annotated_document table whose reference_count column equals 0. See ReferenceComparator for an explanantion. No ORDER BY clause is used; filters applied subsequently cannot rely on the records being sorted in any particular order.
    2. Then the SharedPreFilter is applied. See here for an explanation of pre-filters.
    3. Then all repository-specific pre-filters are applied. Any number of additional pre-filters can be defined for specimens, DNA extracts and extract plates.
    4. Then the SharedPostFilter is applied. See here for an explanation of post-filters.
    5. Then all repository-specific post-filters are applied.
    6. Then the SharedSetFilter is applied. See here for an explanation of set filters.
    7. Then all repository-specific set filters are applied.
    8. Then the remaining records are sorted in descending order of their database ID.

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman
